security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only AI instructions for formatting meeting notes. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Create structured meeting notes with action items
content.value_statement: Meeting notes often become disorganized and miss key action items. This skill provides templates and structured approaches to capture decisions, tasks, and follow-ups in formats that teams can easily reference and track.
actual_capabilities: Structure meeting notes with clear sections for agenda, attendees, and discussions
Extract action items with owners, due dates, and acceptance criteria
Document decisions with rationale and impact assessments
Provide templates for standups, planning, retrospectives, and decision logs
Format notes for easy sharing and archival
Track follow-up items and parking lot topics
limitations: Does not record audio or video from meetings
Does not integrate with calendar or video conferencing tools
Requires user to provide meeting discussion content
Does not send notes to external systems automatically

use_cases.title: Standardize team meeting documentation
use_cases.description: Create consistent, searchable meeting notes across all team meetings with clear action item tracking.

use_cases.title: Capture sprint planning details
use_cases.description: Document sprint goals, capacity planning, commitments, and risks in structured formats for agile teams.

use_cases.title: Run effective retrospectives
use_cases.description: Structure retrospective discussions with start, stop, continue formats and action item follow-through.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Meeting Notes
prompt_templates.prompt: @meeting-notes Capture key discussion points, decisions made, and action items from this meeting. Include owners and deadlines.

prompt_templates.title: Sprint Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: @meeting-notes --type planning Document sprint goal, capacity, backlog items, commitments, risks, and definition of done.

prompt_templates.title: Decision Log
prompt_templates.prompt: @meeting-notes --type decision-log Capture the decision made, rationale, alternatives considered, impact, and owner for implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Retrospective
prompt_templates.prompt: @meeting-notes --type retrospective Structure what went well, what didn't, action items, and experiments for the next sprint.

output_examples.input: During today's standup, the team discussed the API delay. Bob will fix the JWT issue by Friday. Sarah needs to update the documentation by Wednesday. We decided to delay the feature to next sprint.
output: - API delay discussed for the feature

best_practices: Capture decisions with clear rationale to prevent re-litigation later
Assign every action item an owner and specific due date
Share notes within 24 hours while discussion is fresh
anti_patterns: Leaving action items without owners or deadlines
Documenting discussions without outcomes or decisions
Waiting more than 48 hours to share meeting notes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use @meeting-notes prefix in your prompt.

faq.question: What meeting types are supported?
faq.answer: Standard meetings, standups, sprint planning, retrospectives, decision logs, and one-on-ones.

faq.question: Does this integrate with Jira or Trello?
faq.answer: No. The skill creates formatted notes but does not create tickets in external project management tools.

faq.question: Is my meeting data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No. Meeting content is processed by the AI and not stored or transmitted by this skill.

faq.question: Why are my notes not formatted correctly?
faq.answer: Provide meeting content in natural language. Include who said what, decisions made, and any mentioned tasks with owners.

faq.question: How is this different from regular AI chat?
faq.answer: The skill applies proven meeting documentation frameworks and templates automatically without requiring you to specify format each time.
